hackathon-description-text: The second iteration of the world's intercollegiate first Bitcoin and Blockchain hackathon. With representation from schools in the Bay Area, we aim to be the world's greatest university blockchain hackathon in terms of both quantity of hackers and quality of hacks.
hackathon-eligibility: You must be a student aged 18+ to participate. No experience programming with bitcoin and blockchain technology is required, just a willingness to learn!
hackathon-rules:
We follow the MLH code of conduct. Please see this here: http://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf
You will immediately be kicked out and blacklisted from all future MLH hackathons if you are caught breaking this code of conduct.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First place winners at the hackathon win 3 Bitcoin.
Second place winners at the hackathon win 2 Bitcoin.
Third place winners at the hackathon win 1 Bitcoin.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=210 Stadium Rim Way, Berkeley, CA 94720, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Hackers will be judged on how original and creative their hack is.
Hackers will be judged on how functional their hack is, specifically the features that they have.
Hackers will be judged on how well the features they describe in their hack work in practice.

hackathon-location-address: 210 Stadium Rim Way, Berkeley, CA 94720, USA
hackathon-description-header: Bay BitHack is a bitcoin and blockchain at UC Berkeley. Last year, we held the first and largest intercollegiate bitcoin hackathon. This year we are going to hold an even larger one.
hackathon-location-description: University of Berkeley - Haas Innovation Lab at Memorial Stadium
